title: Their Eyes Were Watching God
author: Zora Neale Hurston
summary: A powerful story of Janie Crawford's journey to self-realization in the early 20th-century South.

title: Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
summary: A young black man's journey through 20th-century America, exploring themes of identity and race.

title: Native Son
author: Richard Wright
summary: The tragic story of Bigger Thomas, a young black man living in poverty in Chicago.

title: Go Tell It on the Mountain
author: James Baldwin
summary: A semi-autobiographical novel about a teenager's spiritual, sexual, and moral awakening.

title: The Souls of Black Folk
author: W. E. B. Du Bois
summary: A seminal work in African-American literature, exploring race, culture, and identity.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
summary: A haunting novel about a former enslaved woman and the legacy of slavery.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
summary: The story of Celie, an African-American woman in the early 20th-century American South.

title: Between the World and Me
author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
summary: A letter from a father to his son about the realities of being Black in America.

title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
author: Maya Angelou
summary: Maya Angelou's memoir of her childhood and coming of age in the segregated South.

title: The Autobiography of Malcolm X
author: Malcolm X and Alex Haley
summary: The life story of Malcolm X, chronicling his journey from street hustler to human rights activist.

title: Do the Right Thing
summary: A powerful film exploring racial tensions in a Brooklyn neighborhood on the hottest day of the year.

title: Malcolm X
summary: An epic biographical drama about the life and legacy of Malcolm X.

title: A Raisin in the Sun
summary: A classic adaptation of Lorraine Hansberry's play about a Black family's dreams and struggles in Chicago.

title: Cooley High
summary: A coming-of-age story set in 1960s Chicago, following the lives of two African-American high school friends.

title: The Wiz
summary: A vibrant reimagining of The Wizard of Oz featuring an all-Black cast, including Diana Ross and Michael Jackson.

title: Songs in the Key of Life
summary: A landmark double album featuring classics like 'Isn't She Lovely' and 'Sir Duke.'

title: What's Going On
summary: A socially conscious masterpiece addressing issues of war, poverty, and environmentalism.

title: Kind of Blue
summary: One of the most influential jazz albums of all time, featuring John Coltrane and Bill Evans.

title: The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill
summary: A groundbreaking album blending hip-hop, soul, and reggae, with deeply personal lyrics.

title: Anthology
summary: A collection of the Temptations' greatest hits, spanning their classic Motown years.

title: At Last!
summary: The debut album from Etta James, featuring the timeless title track 'At Last.'

title: The Best of Nina Simone
summary: A compilation of Nina Simone's most iconic songs, blending jazz, blues, and soul.

title: Super Fly
summary: A classic soundtrack album known for its socially aware lyrics and funky grooves.

title: The Essential Aretha Franklin
summary: A two-disc anthology featuring the Queen of Soul's greatest hits.

title: Black America Sings the Blues
summary: A collection of classic blues tracks performed by legendary African-American artists.

title: Ebony
summary: A monthly magazine focusing on news, culture, and achievements in the African-American community.

title: Jet
summary: A weekly magazine covering news, entertainment, and culture for African-Americans.

title: Essence
summary: A lifestyle magazine for African-American women, featuring fashion, beauty, and culture.

title: The Crisis
summary: The official magazine of the NAACP, focusing on civil rights, history, and culture.

title: The Chicago Defender
summary: A historic African-American newspaper known for its role in the Great Migration.

title: The Amsterdam News
summary: A leading African-American newspaper based in New York City.

title: The Pittsburgh Courier
summary: One of the most influential African-American newspapers of the 20th century.

title: Selma
summary: A powerful dramatization of the 1965 Selma to Montgomery voting rights marches.

title: Black Panther
summary: A groundbreaking superhero film celebrating African and African-American culture.

title: The Spook Who Sat by the Door
summary: A politically charged film about the first Black CIA agent who uses his training to organize a revolutionary movement in Chicago.
